page.title: 04Roepark Farm, Mow Cop
page.content: Our class walked from the Old Man of Mow (National Trust) along the Staffordshire Way, which follows the county border. In between this path and the woods below, there are fields which belong to Roepark Farm. We called at the farm and asked the farmer's wife, Mrs. Brookes about her farm. It is a 62 acre farm and there are 80 beef cattle and a few sheep on it. The farmer has four dogs and two cats as well. Hay is the only crop grown and this is to feed the animals in winter. They fertilize the fields twice a year after cutting. To do many of the tasks such as baling, muckspreading and carrying, the farmer uses a tractor, an International. The farm used to be run as a dairy farm and they still have some milking equipment.
